intro: Houstonia obtusifolia, commonly known as the bluntleaf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Houstonia obtusifolia is often found in association with other woodland wildflowers, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
